content: @Nicolò Cavalleri @Sebastien Gouezel It has been quiet on this PR for a while? Are there nasty problems? Or just holidays?
I should take care of it this week end I just moved to Paris so I've had little time for it
I will be doing M2 officially at PSL, practically I will have 3 courses at ENS, 2 at Jussieu and 1 at observatoire de Paris!
It's a new one it's called mathématiques appliquées et théoriques
Nice, we'll get PDEs in mathlib very soon then!
Haha indeed I chose this master mainly because I needed to take a couple PDEs courses, but I will still be doing mainly geometry (symplectic mostly)!
Which symplectic geometry courses do you plan to attend?

Well I have to take Introduction à la topologie symplectique I & II by Viterbo at ENS and then also a course on hamiltonian dynamical systems by Fejoz and Niederman. I could also take the ones by Xiaonan Ma at Diderot but I probably will not have time. Do you recommend anything?

Those are very different courses. Of course my recommendation is to follow Viterbo in priority. This will be as far from formalized mathematics as you can get, but Viterbo is a giant of symplectic topology and very nice. Fejoz and Niederman will be pure dynamical systems, I wouldn't really call that geometry. Since you like Lie groups and physics you'll probably enjoy Ma's course as well. Don't forget to also visit http://symplectic2021.math.cnrs.fr/ especially following the link to the introductory school at https://conferences.cirm-math.fr/2329.html
